captions.text:
I will never be the first to set foot on an uncharted
island.
Or stumble through the jungle onto an
undiscovered Mayan city.
Brave men like Columbus, Magellan, Cortez
ruined my chance
at ever becoming an great explorer.

The closest I will ever come to venturing into
the unknown,
and discovering far off places,
will be on my motorcycle.
I don't care about shiny chrome,
or loud exhaust.
I don't ride to be seen, I ride because I want to disappear.
For me it's about freedom.
The freedom to explore.
To get lost.
To find somewhere silent.
It may only have one 650cc cylinder.
And the trim is no longer shiny and green.
It has rust and scratches.
And more than a few pieces that need to be replaced.

But I didn't buy to ride up and down main street
on sunny days.
And I don't turn around when the pavement ends.
I take adventures not road trips.
I wear protective gear,
not because I might fall,
but because on roads like these I know I will.
This is my ticket to unlimited adventure.
This is my ugly, old, slow
KLR650.
And I'm going to have more fun with it
than anyone on any other bike in the world.

level and had fun doing it!﻿

comments.text:

prompted you to do that, out of curiosity?)
EVERYBODY...take HalfThrottle's lead and make your videos accessible!﻿
comments.author: Larry Littleton

comments.text:
+Larry Littleton I just added the captions to my latest video which is a 
spoof of this video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hGibK_d0mQ0  I typed 
them up and uploaded them, but I think they may take some time to actually 
begin to show up. Might want to check back later to see if they are live.
comments.author: halfthrottle

comments.text:
+halfthrottle You are correct, the YouTube auto-captions suck, and 
completely RUIN videos.  But for cheap amusement, I watch them sometimes, 
just to see what kind of mistakes come up.  We cannot depend on them for 
intelligent or technical information.
comments.author: Larry Littleton

comments.text:
+Larry Littleton I think YouTube generates some automatic captions, but 
they are filled with mistakes.
comments.author: halfthrottle

comments.text:
+halfthrottle You are so very right.  As a profoundly deaf motorcycle 
rider, I enjoy watching videos with captions.  I appreciate the "extra 
work" you put into this, and hope you find it worthwhile to do it on ALL 
your videos.  I'll be a faithful viewer!
Mahalo, again!
comments.author: Larry Littleton

comments.text:
Those captions are in English and Spanish. It's a little extra work to 
write everything out and make it show up in the right spot. But it helps 
more people enjoy the video, and I read that google can use that 
information to help people searching for this type of video find it.

No, not genocide. You are using the wrong word, friend. The destruction of

comments.author: Chris Moore

comments.text:
She's already decided she likes the Yamaha TW200 because it's small and 
weak enough for her to learn on, but also "it's cute." I'm pretty rusty 
myself, not having ridden in, oh, 30 years or so. We can probably teach our 
daughter on it, too. Eventually we'll have to have a family of bikes, I can 
see already. I showed her this video and her face lit up in a huge smile. 
Great work, man!
comments.author: Chris Moore

comments.text:
Gotta tell you how I found out: My daughter's friend was over and she says 
"Let's do a bucket list!' Because, you know, that's what 8-year-olds do, 
right? Anyway, my wife did it with them, while I went to tinker with 
something in the basement. I forgot all about it until like a week later, I 
see one of the lists in a stack of papers. One of the entries says "Learn 
how to ride and buy a motorcycle." I asked my wife, "Is this your list?" 
When she said yes, I did a little happy dance!
comments.author: Chris Moore

comments.text: I'd tell you to lock her down, but you already have!
